original_text: Image Español You have flu symptoms, so you’ve been getting some relief by taking a cough and flu medicine every few hours. Late in the day, you have a headache and think about grabbing a couple of ac...

qa_pairs.text_input: What is the daily limit of acetaminophen?
qa_pairs.output: The maximum recommended adult dose of acetaminophen is 4,000 milligrams per day for all medicines you might be taking.

qa_pairs.text_input: What should you do if you still have pain and fever after treatment?
qa_pairs.output: If you still have pain and fever after treatment, don’t take more than directed. Instead, discuss this with your health care professional.

qa_pairs.text_input: How can you avoid exceeding the daily limit of acetaminophen?
qa_pairs.output: To avoid exceeding that dose: Be aware of the number of milligrams of acetaminophen in all the medicines you are taking. Don’t take more than one OTC medicine containing acetaminophen. Don’t take a prescription and an OTC medicine containing acetaminophen unless advised to do so by your health care professional.
